page.title: 02POPULATION OF ASHILL VILLAGE
page.content: The present population of{Ashill}is approx 1450, including approx 250 under the age of 18. The village has grown to its present size from a population of 500 in the mid 1960's, the "newcomers" live on a number of new estates which consist largely of bungalows,{(Fairholme, {Millfield, Lewis Cl., Acacia Av., {Woodlands, Orchard Cl. and The Limes) and some of houses,{(The Oaks, Fir {Park and The Meres).}The bungalows are largely inhabited by "retired" pensioners, a high proportion from the London area, whilst the houses are mainly inhabited by families. The high proportion of bungalows reflect the number of retired people in the village, approx 50%, these are partly balanced by the younger families so a reasonable mix of ages is achieved. New and old villagers usually mix well
